ingredients.item: 300g pack frozen Bramley apple slices, defrosted

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 200°C, gas mark 6.

To make the pastry, place the flour, salt and caster sugar in a bowl. Rub 100g butter into the flour with your fingertips until it resembles breadcrumbs. Add 3-4 tbsp cold water and mix to form a dough. Wrap in cling film and chill for half an hour.
Meanwhile, melt the remaining 25g butter in a frying pan and fry the apple slices for 3 minutes. Mix in the breadcrumbs, cinnamon, sultanas and 3 tbsp demerara sugar and cook for 30 seconds.
Roll out half the pastry to a 25cm round and place on a greased baking tray. Spoon over the apple mixture leaving a 2cm border round the edges, brush the border with water.

Roll out the remaining half of the pastry to a 26cm round, place on top of the apples and fold over the pastry edges to enclose the pie. Brush with milk and sprinkle with the remaining Demerara sugar. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden.
